00019 namespace BulletHell.Game.Library.xml
00020 {
00021     /* After I wrote this class, I realized that a validator is already present in the C# System.Xml.
00022      * Writing a whole new validator seems to be time-wasting, however, 
00023      * I do appreciate my own class as I know it's capability and how the underlying validation works. */
00024 
00025     public class XmlValidator
00026     {
00027         private Stack<XmlTag> stack = new Stack<XmlTag>();
00028         private XmlStruct xmlStruct = null;
00029         private int indent = 0; // To be used with DEBUG, keeps track of indentation
00030 
00031         public XmlValidator(XmlStruct xmlStruct)
00032         {
00033             this.xmlStruct = xmlStruct;
00034         }
00035 
00036         /* Validates the file given, with the xmlStruct */
00037         public bool validateXml(String filename)
00038         {
00039             stack.Clear();
00040             XmlTextReader reader = new XmlTextReader(filename);
00041             try
00042             {
00043                 while (reader.Read())
00044                 {
00045                     switch (reader.NodeType)
00046                     {
00047                         case XmlNodeType.Element: // Open tag
00048                             if (_GLOBAL.Debug)
00049                             {
00050                                 for (int i = 0; i < indent; ++i)
00051                                     Console.Write("\t");
00052                                 Console.Write("<" + reader.Name.ToLower());
00053                                 indent++;
00054                             }
00055 
00056                             /* Reads the tag and its attribs */
00057                             readElement(xmlStruct, reader, xmlStruct.getTagFromString(reader.Name.ToLower()));
00058 
00059                             /* If the tag is an EssentialTag, removes it from the struct. 
00060                              * At the end if all EssentialTags are removed, then it means all of the required tags are satisfied */
00061                             if (xmlStruct.EssentialTags.Contains((TagID)stack.Peek().tagId))
00062                                 xmlStruct.EssentialTags.Remove((TagID)stack.Peek().tagId);
00063 
00064                             if (_GLOBAL.Debug) Console.WriteLine(">");
00065                             break;
00066                         case XmlNodeType.Text: // Value of tag
00067                             if (_GLOBAL.Debug)
00068                             {
00069                                 for (int i = 0; i < indent; ++i)
00070                                     Console.Write("\t");
00071                                 Console.WriteLine(reader.Value);
00072                             }
00073                             break;
00074                         case XmlNodeType.EndElement: // Close tag
00075                             if (_GLOBAL.Debug)
00076                             {
00077                                 indent--;
00078                                 for (int i = 0; i < indent; ++i)
00079                                     Console.Write("\t");
00080                                 Console.WriteLine("</" + reader.Name.ToLower() + ">");
00081                             }
00082 
00083                             if (stack.Peek().Tag != reader.Name.ToLower())
00084                                 throw new Exception("Error 2: " + stack.Peek().Tag + " should be closed before preceeding. " + "Line " + reader.LineNumber + ", position " + reader.LinePosition);
00085 
00086                             stack.Pop();
00087                             break;
00088                         case XmlNodeType.Comment:
00089                             break; // ignore comments
00090                     }
00091                 }
00092 
00093                 if (xmlStruct.EssentialTags.Count > 0)
00094                     throw new Exception("Error 7: Not all required tags for the xmlStruct are satisfied.");
00095 
00096                 return true;
00097             }
00098             catch (Exception e)
00099             {
00100                 Console.WriteLine(e.Message);
00101             }
00102             return false;
00103         }
00104 
00105         private void readAttribute(XmlTag tag, XmlTextReader reader, XmlTag element)
00106         {
00107             List<string> essentialAttributes = null; //C# doesn't have copy constructor
00108             if (tag.EssentialAttributes != null)
00109             {
00110                 essentialAttributes = new List<string>();
00111                 foreach (string attrib in tag.EssentialAttributes)
00112                     essentialAttributes.Add(attrib);
00113             }
00114 
00115             while (reader.MoveToNextAttribute())
00116             {
00117                 if (tag.Attributes != null && tag.Attributes.Count > 0 && tag.Attributes.ContainsKey(reader.Name.ToLower()))
00118                 {
00119                     if (_GLOBAL.Debug) Console.Write(" " + reader.Name.ToLower() + "=\"" + reader.Value.ToLower() + "\"");
00120                     if (essentialAttributes != null)
00121                         essentialAttributes.Remove(reader.Name.ToLower()); // Doesn't check for dupe attribs, C# checks it for us
00122                     continue;
00123                 }
00124                 throw new Exception("Error 3: " + tag.Tag + " does not have an Attribute called '" + reader.Name.ToLower() + "'. " + "Line " + reader.LineNumber + ", position " + reader.LinePosition);
00125             }
00126             if (essentialAttributes != null && essentialAttributes.Count > 0)
00127                 throw new Exception("Error 6: Not all required attributes for '" + tag.Tag + "' are satisified. " + "Line " + reader.LineNumber + ", position " + reader.LinePosition);
00128         }
00129 
00130         private bool readChildren(XmlTag tag, XmlTextReader reader, XmlTag element)
00131         {
00132             int i;
00133             for (i = 0; tag.Children != null && i < tag.Children.Count; ++i)
00134                 if (element.Tag == tag.Children[i].Tag)
00135                     return true;
00136 
00137             if (tag.Children == null || i >= tag.Children.Count)
00138                 throw new Exception("Error 4: " + tag.Tag + " does not have a child tag called '" + reader.Name.ToLower() + "'. " + "Line " + reader.LineNumber + ", position " + reader.LinePosition);
00139 
00140             return false;
00141         }
00142 
00143         private void readElement(XmlStruct xmlStruct, XmlTextReader reader, XmlTag element)
00144         {
00145             /* If the stack is emepty, push only the root tag */
00146             if (stack.Count == 0 && element.Tag == xmlStruct.Root.Tag)
00147             {
00148                 stack.Push(element);
00149                 readAttribute(xmlStruct.Root, reader, element);
00150             }
00151             else if (stack.Count > 0 && readChildren(stack.Peek(), reader, element)) // else push, if the tag is a child of the stack.Peek().
00152             {
00153                 stack.Push(element);
00154                 readAttribute(stack.Peek(), reader, element);
00155             }
00156             else
00157                 throw new Exception("Error 5: Invalid Tag '" + element.Tag + "'. " + "Line " + reader.LineNumber + ", position " + reader.LinePosition);
00158         }
00159     }
00160 }
